e4: While a change in policy might cause short-term market fluctuations due to investor adjustment, prioritizing honest reporting builds trust and credibility with investors in the long run. It also mitigates potential legal risks associated with the current deceptive practice.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy above all else. It should provide a clear, unbiased representation of the company's financial performance, allowing stakeholders to make informed decisions. This includes avoiding any intentional manipulation or distortion of data, clearly disclosing any assumptions or limitations in the reported figures, and adhering to recognized accounting standards and regulations. Ultimately, ethical reporting builds trust and fosters sustainable relationships with investors and other stakeholders.
e6: Yes, I would have some follow-up questions for the management team.  Primarily, I'd want to understand their plan for communicating the policy change to investors and how they intend to mitigate any potential negative short-term market reactions. Additionally, I'd inquire about the legal risks associated with both the current and proposed policies, seeking assurance from legal counsel regarding the best course of action.
